author: sky.cactus
content:
> Stateless clients need to be able to expose and serve the JSON-RPC API.
> Stateless clients need to be able to participate in transaction gossip even when they donâ€™t have any of the state.
In your article you have those two as AND requirements.  I contend that there is value even if they are OR requirements.

author: sky.cactus
content: I think if stateless clients could gossip, but not serve JSON-RPC that is valuable.  I also think that if stateless clients could serve JSON-RPC but not gossip that is also valuable.

author: sky.cactus
content: Right now we have *many* users who *neither* gossip *nor* handle their own JSON-RPC (everyone who uses infura/alchemy).  Either getting some of those users participating in gossip, or getting some of those users serving their own JSON-RPC requests would be an improvement over the current situation.

author: pipermerriam
content: worth noting that `eth_sendTransaction` depends on gossip so there's some interdependency between these things

author: pipermerriam
content: And JSON-RPC drops very quickly in usefulness when you start removing endpoints.
